details.title: Global COVID-19 count surpasses 20 million mark
details.content:
• The number of confirmed cases COVID-19 worldwide has surpassed 20 million, according to Johns Hopkins University
  • It said the global case tally stood at 20,001,019 on Monday night, with 733,897 deaths and 12,200,847 recoveries
  • While the global coronavirus death toll surpassed 728,000 people
  • WHO declared the outbreak of the new coronavirus a pandemic on March 11

(Inputs from ANI)

details.title: Number of active COVID-19 cases has come down: PM
details.content: Prime Minister Modi during a virtual meeting with Chief Ministers said that the active number of COVID-19 cases have come down. "The average fatality rate has been continuously decreasing while the recovery rate is increasing every day, this shows that measures being taken by us are in the right direction. We have seen that in some districts of UP, Haryana & Delhi, there was a phase when COVID-19 became a huge problem. Then we held a review meeting & a committee was formed under the chairmanship of Amit Shah and to a great extent, we achieved the results that we wanted," he added.

details.title: COVID-19 recovery rate in TN is 80.8%, says EPS
details.content: “As on date, 2,44,675 patients have recovered, which works out to a recovery rate of 80.8 percent, one of the highest in the country. Tamil Nadu is currently conducting the maximum number of PCR tests in the country. The proactive and aggressive approach has resulted in the declining trend of new positive cases in Chennai. A similar approach is being adopted in the rest of the state,” the Chief Minister said during his discussions with the Prime Minister on COVID-19 prevention measures. (READ MORE)

details.title: Puducherry govt to seek Rs 25 crore from Centre to combat virus
details.content: The Puducherry administration will seek Rs 25 crore from the central government to meet the requirements for combating COVID-19 in the Union territory, Health Minister Malladi Krishna Rao said here on Tuesday.

details.title: Ravindra Jadeja's wife caught without mask, argues with cops
details.content: The cricketer's wife had a heated argument with head constable Sonal Gosai when the latter stopped her car at Kisanpara Chowk after noticing that she was not wearing a mask. (READ MORE)

details.title: Mizoram orders fuel rationing amid shortage due to restrictions
details.content: The Mizoram government on Tuesday capped the quantity of fuel that can be purchased per vehicle as the state's stock was running out due to restrictions imposed in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, as per an official order. (READ MORE)

details.title: 'COVID cases' doubling rate in Delhi is now over 50 days'
details.content: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said that capital's doubling rate of coronavirus cases has now gone up to over 50 days while across India it is around 20 days.

details.content: According to the guidelines issued by the Home department on Tuesday, there will be no parade and march past during the celebrations. Around 50 to 75 guests including Covid warriors will be invited to the celebrations using e-invites. About 15 to 20 Covid warriors including doctors and health and sanitation workers will be invited. details.title: COVID-19 recovery rate nears 70 per cent: Govt
details.content: Successful implementation of containment strategy, aggressive testing coupled with standardized clinical management of critical patients have resulted in the rise of COVID-19 recovery rate to nearly 70 per cent while the case fatality rate has fallen below 2 per cent, the Union Health ministry said on Tuesday.

details.title: Mamata raises issue of financial dues to WB during COVID-19 meeting with PM
details.content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee Tuesday raised the issue of West Bengal's financial dues from the Centre during a video conference on the pandemic and urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to ensure that the Centre issues guidelines on which vaccine to be procured and used to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. (READ MORE)

details.title: WATCH | Sputnik V: Russia registers world's 'first' COVID-19 vaccine
Worship in religious places in Gurugram  permitted from August 12
details.content: Worship in religious places in Gurugram district to be permitted from August 12, subject to operators of temples complying with certain terms and conditions. Large gathering/congregation continue to remain prohibited.

details.title: States must not get overawed by increase in positive cases: Health Ministry
details.content: The Health Ministry on Tuesday said states should not get overawed by a "mere increase" in daily positive cases of COVID-19 and should keep pursuing the policy of aggressive testing, comprehensive tracing and tracking and efficient treatment of cases.(READ MORE)

details.title: 1,417 COVID cases in Kerala; 36 health workers also infected
details.content: Kerala continued to witness a spike in COVID-19 infections reporting 1,417 cases on Tuesday, including 36 health workers, as the death toll climbed to 120 with five more fatalities. As many as 1,426 people recovered from the infection today, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan told reporters.

details.title: 9,024 fresh COVID-19 cases in Andhra Pradesh, 87 deaths
details.content: Andhra Pradesh's COVID-19 tally went up to 2,44,549 on Tuesday as 9,024 fresh cases were added, while 87 more deaths pushed the overall toll to 2,203. According to the latest bulletin 9,113 patients were discharged from hospitals in the state after recovering from the disease. More positive cases were detected in rapid antigen tests as compared to RT-PCR, TruNat and other tests in the last 24 hours in the state.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath visits Gorakhpur 'to be with' flood, virus-hit people
details.content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday distributed relief materials among the people hit by floods in Gorakhpur district and said the state government was committed to help all those affected by flooding and the COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: Delhi records 8 deaths due to COVID-19, lowest in over 2 months
details.content: Delhi recorded 1,257 fresh coronavirus cases, and eight deaths, the lowest in over two months, in the last 24 hours, authorities said on Tuesday. This is the first time in over two months that the daily number of deaths has dropped below 10, according to the Delhi government's health bulletin.

details.title: One more succumbs to COVID-19 in Himachal Pradesh, death toll now 17
details.content: A 78-year-old woman died of COVID-19 in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district on Tuesday, raising the death toll due to the disease to 17, officials said. The hilly state also reported 18 fresh infections, taking the COVID-19 case tally to 3,482, they said.

details.title: TMC government has failed to tackle COVID-19 crisis: Dilip Ghosh
details.content: The West Bengal BJP unit on Tuesday alleged that the Trinamool Congress government has failed to tackle the COVID-19 crisis as the number of coronavirus cases in the state is rising.

details.title: Tamil Nadu government says treatment for non-virus cases unaffected
details.content: Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said despite the pandemic, treatment for patients suffering from other illnesses was being provided in government hospitals without any break.

details.title: Raj Bhavan open for people in distress due to COVID-19: Mizoram Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai
details.content: The Raj Bhavan in Aizawl is open for those in need of shelter or assistance due to the COVID-19 outbreak, Mizoram Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai said on Tuesday. A state-wide partial lockdown is in force till August 31.

details.title: Sikkim reports three fresh COVID-19 cases
details.content: Sikkim on Tuesday reported three new COVID-19 cases, taking the Himalayan state's tally to 913, an official of the Health department said. Director General (DG)-cum-Secretary, Health, Dr Pempa T Bhutia said that South Sikkim has reported two positive cases and East Sikkim one case.

details.title: Bengal COVID cases cross 1 lakh-mark; 49 fresh deaths reported
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in West Bengal breached the one lakh-mark on Tuesday to reach 1,01,390 after 2,931 new infections were reported, the state health department said. The death toll mounted to 2,149 with 49 fresh fatalities, the department said in a bulletin.

details.title: Over 1 lakh COVID patients discharged so far in Karnataka, 6,257 new infections
details.content: Over one lakh COVID-19 patients have been discharged so far after recovery in Karnataka, as the state on Tuesday reported 6,257 new cases and 86 fatalities. The total number of infections now stood at 1,88,611 and death toll was 3,398, the health department said. Recoveries overtook the number of cases reported on Tuesday, with 6,473 patients being discharged.

details.title: Janmashtmi: Punjab govt relaxes coronavirus curfew
details.content: The Punjab government has decided to give a two-hour relxation in the coronavirus curfew across the state on the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday in the wake of Janmashtami, an official said.

details.title: No large gatherings during I-DAY celebrations in Haryana
details.content: The Haryana government on Tuesday decided not to allow large gatherings and advised against the participation of children below 10 years in the Independence day functions across the state, according to an official. The decision has come in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

details.content:
Way to battle #COVID! Wearing masks and maintaining #SocialDistancing, these children in Karnataka study, sitting beneath a banyan tree & temple premises that has been turned into a 'school'. @XpressBengaluru @shibasahu2012

details.title: Punjabi attitude of 'koyi gal nahin' delaying COVID-19 testing: CM Amarinder Singh
details.content: Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh said Tuesday the Punjabi attitude of 'koyi gal nahin' was causing people to delay their COVID-19 testing until it became inevitable, warning them it could prove detrimental in some cases. Singh blamed the attitude for the higher-than-Haryana mortality rate in Punjab.

details.title: 20 fresh COVID-19 cases in Nagaland; count rises to 3,031
details.content: Nagaland's COVID-19 tally rose to 3,031 on Tuesday as 20 more people tested positive for the infection, health officials said. Ten new cases were detected in Kohima district, nine in Dimapur and one in Tuensang, Health Minister S Pangnyu Phom tweeted.

details.title: Surat records 236 new COVID-19 cases; 10 die, 183 recover
details.content: The coronavirus tally in Surat rose to 16,282 with 236 new cases reported on Tuesday in the district, the Gujarat health department said. The COVID-19 death toll in Surat crossed the 700-mark and rose to 705 with ten new deaths - five each in the city and rural parts of the south Gujarat district, the department said in a release.

details.title: COVID-19: Nepal halves entry points for Indians, extends suspension of flights until August 31
details.content: Nepal has decided to halve the number of designated entry points for Indian nationals to 10 from the existing 20 and extended the suspension of domestic and international flights until August 31 due to the spike in coronavirus cases in the country. (READ MORE)

details.title: BJD MLA S R Patnaik tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: Ruling Biju Janata Dal MLA and editor of Odia daily 'Sambad' SR Patnaik on Tuesday tested positive for COVID-19. Patnaik, the BJD MLA from Khandapada in Nayagarh district, in his twitter post informed about him being detected as COVID-19 positive.

details.title: Punjab reports record 32 COVID deaths, over 1,000 fresh cases
details.content: Punjab on Tuesday reported a record 32 fatalities due to COVID-19, pushing the death toll to 636, while 1,002 fresh cases took the state's infection tally to 25,889. Eleven fatalities were reported in Ludhiana, four in Sangrur, three each in Amritsar, Patiala, Jalandhar and Mohali and one each in Gurdaspur, Bathinda, Kapurthala, Muktsar and Tarn Taran, according to a medical bulletin.

details.title: Maharashtra adds 11,088 new COVID-19 cases; 256 die, 10,014 recover
details.content: Maharashtra on Tuesday reported 11,088 fresh cases of COVID-19, taking its tally to 5,35,601, while 256 more patients died due to the infection, said a state health official. After the addition of new cases, the state's tally rose to 5,35,601, while the COVID-19 fatality figure increased to 18,306, he said.

details.title: Southern states continue reporting high COVID-19 caseloads
details.content: Southern states continued reporting high COVID-19 caseloads on Wednesday, the numbers being close to 25,000, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi took stock of the situation with four of the most affected ones from the region--Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Telangana.

details.title: Centre's help in providing COVID test kits to Uttar Pradesh must continue: CM Yogi Adityanath to PM
details.content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to continue the arrangement for providing RTPCR test kits and other COVID-related equipment for use in the state.

details.title: Bihar reports highest single-day spike of 4,071 cases; 15 more fatalities push death toll to 465
details.content: Bihar reported its highest single-day spike in COVID-19 cases on Tuesday as 4,071 more people tested positive for the infection, while 15 more fatalities pushed its coronavirus death toll to 465, a health bulletin said.

details.title: Chhattisgarh adds 313 new COVID-19 cases; deaths cross 100-mark
details.content: Chhattisgarh reported 313 new COVID-19 cases, nine of them ITBP personnel, and five more deaths, taking the statewide tally to 12,938 and the toll above the 100-mark to 104 on Tuesday, a health official said.

details.title: Fishing labourers entering Karnataka from other states to be quarantined in boats on arrival
details.content: Deep sea fishing is likely to start on September 1 in the Karnataka Coast after a gap of nearby five months. Kota Srinivas Poojary, minister for ports and fisheries who held a meeting with district officials and stakeholders in the business, said free COVID test will be conducted on fishing labourers coming from outside the state if they do not possess a COVID negative certificate. (READ MORE)

details.title: Gujarat's COVID-19 cases rise by 1,118 to 73,238; 23 die
details.content: Gujarat on Tuesday reported 1,118 new COVID-19 cases, raising the total count to 73,238 in the state, Health department said. The number of fatalities increased by 23 to 2,697, it said. With 1,140 patients getting discharged in the day, the number of recoveries mounted to 56,416, the department said in a release.

details.title: Delhi Police asks invitees not to come if they had COVID-19 symptoms within 2 weeks before I-Day
details.content: The Delhi Police Tuesday advised invitees for the Independence Day function at the Red Fort here to refrain from attending it if they experienced any COVID-19 symptom within two weeks before the event and haven't got tested.

details.title: J-K's COVID-19 tally reaches 25,931
details.content: Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday recorded 564 new coronavirus cases, taking the caseload to 25,931, while 12 patients died due to the disease in the last 24 hours, officials said. Ten deaths were reported in the Kashmir valley, while two patients died in the Jammu region.

details.title: Ahmedabad records 150 new COVID-19 cases; 204 discharged
details.content: Ahmedabad reported 150 new coronavirus cases on Tuesday, taking the total in the district to 28,192, the Gujarat health department said. The death toll rose to 1,640 with three new fatalities, it said. The number of recovered cases rose to 22,816 with 204 more patients getting discharged, the department said.

details.title: Himachal Pradesh High Court asks state government not to shift COVID patients from Sirmaur, Solan to DDU
details.content: The Himachal Pradesh High Court on Tuesday directed the state government not to shift COVID-19 patients from Sirmaur and Solan to the Deen Dayal Upadhyay Hospital here unless health facilities in these districts run out of required infrastructure.

details.title: Cases in Pune district might cross 1.60 lakh by month-end
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Pune district might cross 1.60 lakh at the end of this month as per the projection of the Maharashtra health department, a senior official said here on Tuesday.

details.title: Coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh cross 40,000-mark, 18 new fatalities
details.content: The number of coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh rose to 40,734 on Tuesday after 843 more people tested positive for the infection, health officials said. The death toll due to the pandemic reached 1,033 with 18 patients succumbing since Monday evening.

details.title: Gautam Buddh Nagar: 89 new COVID-19 cases reported, total count 6,101
details.content: Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar on Tuesday recorded 89 new COVID-19 cases, pushing the tally of coronavirus cases in the district to 6,101, official data showed.

details.title: Punjab to release up to 4,000 more prisoners to decongest jails in view of COVID-19
details.content: Punjab will release 3,500 to 4,000 more prisoners to ensure better compliance with COVID-19 guidelines in jails, a minister said on Tuesday. The state has already released a total of 9,500 prisoners to decongest jails in view of the pandemic.

details.title: 75 fresh COVID-19 cases reported in Chandigarh; infection tally at 1,670
details.content: Chandigarh reported 75 fresh coronavirus cases and one death due to the disease on Tuesday, taking the infection tally to 1,670 in the Union territory. An 81-year-old woman succumbed to the infection on Monday.

details.title: 411 test positive for COVID-19 in Uttarakhand
details.content: Uttarakhand's COVID-19 tally rose to 10,432 on Tuesday with 411 people testing positive, while two more deaths due to the virus pushed the toll to 136 in the state, the health department said.

details.title: All hotels, eateries of Madhya Pradesh tourism corporation reopen
details.content: After a gap of over four months, the State Tourism Development Corporation of Madhya Pradesh has opened all its hotels and restaurants, an official said on Tuesday. The outbreak of coronavirus had forced closure of over 60 hotels and restaurants that the corporation runs in the state in March.

details.title: 710 COVID patients received plasma from banks, 921 donated: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
details.content: Over 700 COVID-19 patients in Delhi have received plasma from designated banks enabling their recovery from coronavirus infection, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Tuesday.

details.title: Aurangabad's COVID-19 cases rise by 254 to 17,304
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district rose by 254 to 17,304 on Tuesday,an official said. With four persons succumbing to the infection, the toll went up to 562 in the district, he said.

details.title: Nagpur's COVID-19 tally crosses 10,000 mark; 38 die
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra's Nagpur district spiked by 977 on Tuesday, which is the highest addition in a single day so far, to 10,361, an official release said.

details.title: BMC starts rapid antigen testing at urban health centres
details.content: The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Tuesday started rapid antigen testing of local residents at nine urban health centres as the Odisha capital has reported a surge in COVID-19 cases, an official said.

details.title: Muzaffarnagar reports 43 fresh coronavirus cases, 14 jail inmates among them
details.content: As many as 43 people, including 14 jail inmates, tested positive for the novel coronavirus in Muzaffarnagar on Tuesday, officials said. With the latest cases, the number of active COVID-19 patients rose to 236 in the district.

details.title: Bombay High Court asks government to consider demand to reopen Jain temples
details.content: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday directed the Maharashtra government to consider representations by the Jain community seeking permission to enter Jain temples during the eight-day Paryushan festival.

details.title: Maharashtra to cap rates of masks and sanitisers soon: Health Minister Rajesh Tope
details.content: Maharashtra will soon become the first state in the country to cap the prices of masks and sanitisers, which are crucial to keep the coronavirus at bay, state Health Minister Rajesh Tope said on Tuesday.

details.title: COVA Mobile App reaches more than 50 lakh users
details.content: COVA Mobile App, helping citizens and government agencies during COVID-19 pandemic, reaches more than 50 lakh users: Punjab Chief Secretary Vini Mahajan

details.title: 25 fresh COVID-19 cases in Mizoram; count rises to 648
details.content: Twenty-five more people, including five BSF personnel, have tested positive for COVID- 19 in Mizoram, taking the northeastern state's virus count to 648 on Wednesday, a health official said. Aizawl and Kolasib districts reported 10 cases each while Lunglei registered five fresh infections, he said.

details.title: Maharashtra government slashes charges for COVID-19 tests by Rs 300
details.content: The Maharashtra government has reduced by Rs 300 the rates of COVID-19 tests conducted by laboratories, bringing them in the range of Rs 1,900 to Rs 2,500. State Health Minister Rajesh Tope said this in a statement on Wednesday.

details.title: 621 new coronavirus patients in Nagpur district
details.content: Nagpur district on Wednesday reported 621 new coronavirus patients, taking the number of cases to 10,982, an official release said. 27 COVID-19 patients died in the district during the day, which took the death toll to 400 (279 from Nagpur city), it said.

details.title: Nagaland's one-day monsoon session on Thursday
details.content: The one-day monsoon session of the Nagaland Legislative Assembly (NLA) will be held on Thursday amid surging Covid-19 cases in the state. The House which was earlier convened on July 30 could not meet at that time after at least 6 assembly staff were found positive for virus a day before.

details.title: Display fee for COVID-19 treatment, pvt hospitals ordered in Telangana
details.content: Following complaints on exorbitant fee charged by private hospitals for COVID-19 treatment, the Telangana government has ordered the healthcare facilities to display the rates.

details.title: 480 new coronavirus patients in Goa, three deaths
details.content: Goa on Wednesday reported 480 new coronavirus patients, which took the tally of new cases to 9,924, the state health department said. 161 people recovered from the infection in the state, taking the number of recovered patients to 6,641, it added.

details.title: 12,712 new coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, 344 deaths
details.content:
Maharashtra on Wednesday reported 12,712 new coronavirus patients and 344 deaths which took the case tally to 5,48,313 and death toll in the state to 18,650, a health official said. 13,804 patients were discharged from hospitals which took the number of recovered coronavirus patients to 3,81,843.

In Maharashtra, 12,712 new #COVID__19 positive patients, 13,498 cured and discharged and 344 deaths are reported. @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) August 12, 2020

details.title: Kerala's COVID-19 tally crosses 38,000; Toll rises to 125
details.content: Kerala on Wednesday reported 1,212 fresh COVID-19 cases, including 22 health workers, and five deaths taking the infection count to38,144 and the toll to 125. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said the day's recoveries stood at 880 and there were 13,045 active cases.

details.title: J&K reports eight more COVID-19 deaths, 482 new cases
details.content: Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday recorded 482 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of infected people to 26,413, even as eight COVID-19 patients died during the last 24 hours in the union territory, officials said.

details.title: West Bengal secretariat to be shut for two days for sanitisation
details.content: West Bengal state secretariat 'Nabanna' will remain closed on Thursday and Friday for a sanitisation drive, an official said. The 14-storied building, located in Howrah, will undergo an intense cleaning and sanitisation process on these two days, the official said on Wednesday.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh COVID-19 tally crosses 2.5 lakh mark with 9,597 new cases
details.content: Adding 9,597 to its tally of COVID-19 cases, Andhra Pradesh on Wednesday crossed the 2.50 lakh mark as the infection positivity rate continued to spiral, reaching 9.59 per cent, overtaking Tamil Nadu. (READ MORE)

details.title: Tamil Nadu records 5,871 fresh COVID-19 cases, 119 deaths
details.content: Tamil Nadu on Wednesday reported 5,871 fresh COVID-19 cases taking the tally to 3,14,520 while 119 fatalities pushed the death toll to 5,278. Active cases stood at 52,929 with 5,633 discharges from various health care facilities and in total 2,56,313 have recovered, a health department bulletin said. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 count goes up by 1,152 in Gujarat; 18 die, 977 recover
details.content: Gujarat reported 1,152 new coronavirus positive cases on Wednesday, pushing the overall tally of the state to 74,390, the health department said. With the death of 18 patients, its fatality count rose to 2,715, it said.

details.title: Punjab records highest single-day spike of 39 COVID-19 deaths
details.content: Punjab on Wednesday witnessed a record 39 fatalities due to COVID-19, pushing the death toll to 675, while 1,020 cases took the state's infection tally to 26,909.

details.title: Ahmedabad's COVID-19 count rises to 28,351; four die
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Ahmedabad district rose by 159 to 28,351 on Wednesday, the Gujarat health department said. With four patients succumbing to the infection, the death toll went up to 1,644, it said.

details.title: Madhya Pradesh's COVID-19 tally crosses 41,000-mark; death toll now 1,048
details.content: The COVID-19 count in Madhya Pradesh rose to 41,604 with the addition of 870 cases in the state on Wednesday, health officials said. The fatality figure rose to 1,048 after 15 patients succumbed to the infection in the last 24 hours, they said.

details.title: Chandigarh reports 81 fresh COVID-19 cases, tally climbs to 1,751
details.content: Chandigarh recorded 81 fresh COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the union territory's tally to 1,751, a medical bulletin said. The death toll in Chandigarh stands at 26, it said. There are 700 active cases in the union territory at present, according to the bulletin.

details.title: 439 new cases of coronavirus in Uttarakhand, 4 fresh deaths
details.content: The coronavirus surge continued in Uttarakhand with 439 people testing positive on Wednesday, taking the state's tally to 10,886, while four fresh deaths pushed the toll to 140, officials said.

details.title: Janmashtami celebrated amid COVID-19 restrictions
details.content: The massive crowds of devotees in temples, elaborately decorated tableaus and Dahi Handi revelry were all missing this year on Janmashtami, the birthday of Lord Krishna, as celebrations were dampened by COVID-19 restrictions.

details.title: Mizoram to boost COVID testing capacity
details.content: The Mizoram government will purchase 10,000 more rapid antigen kits to boost the states COVID-19 testing capacity, Chief minister Zoramthanga said on Wednesday.

details.title: COVID-19 tally at 6,182 in Noida, recovery rate over 85%
details.content: Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar on Wednesday recorded 84 new COVID-19 patients, pushing the tally of cases in the district to 6,182, official data showed.

details.title: Bengal reports 54 fresh COVID deaths, 2,936 new cases
details.content: The COVID-19 toll in West Bengal rose to 2,203 on Wednesday after 54 people succumbed to the disease, the health department said. The state's coronavirus count has gone up to 1,04,326 after 2,936 new cases of infection were reported, a bulletin released by the department said.

details.title: Three more COVID-19 deaths in Haryana; 797 fresh cases
details.content: Three more deaths due to COVID-19 were reported in Haryana on Wednesday, taking the total fatalities in the state to 503, according to the health department's daily bulletin.

details.title: 1,132 COVID-19 cases added in Mumbai; 50 succumb, 923 recover
details.content: With the single-day rise of 1,132 COVID-19 cases, the infection tally in Mumbai rose to 1,26,371 on Wednesday, while the death toll mounted to 6,940 with 50 new fatalities, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said.

details.title: Sikkim reports 17 new COVID-19 cases
details.content: Sikkim on Wednesday reported 17 new cases of COVID-19, taking the state's tally to 930, an official said. All the new cases have been reported from East Sikkim, said Director General-cum-Secretary, Health, Pempa T Bhutia.

details.title: COVID-19 cases reach 21,839 in Nashik; 16 die
details.content: The count of COVID-19 cases in Nashik district of Maharashtra rose to 21,839 on Wednesday with the single-day addition of 763 patients, health officials said. With 16 patients succumbing to the infection, the toll in the district went up to 648, they said.

details.title: Industrialist Palem Srikanth Reddy succumbs to COVID-19
details.content: Palem Srikanth Reddy, popular industrialist and a former TDP candidate who stood against current CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy in the 2009 Lok Sabha elections, passed away on Wednesday after a month-long battle againt COVID-19. (READ MORE)

details.title: 87 new COVID-19 cases in Nagaland; tally rises to 3,118
details.content: Nagaland on Wednesday reported 87 new COVID-19 cases while 129 people recovered from the virus in the state, an official of the Heath department said. With the 87 fresh cases, the state's COVID-19 tally has increased to 3,118 of which 1,991 are active cases as 1,113 people have recovered from the disease, eight have died and six have migrated to other states, the official said.

details.title: 53 fresh COVID-19 cases in Ladakh
details.content: A total of 53 fresh COVID-19 cases were reported in Ladakh, taking the Union Territory's tally to 1,770, officials said on Wednesday. Ladakh accounted for nine coronavirus-related deaths, while 1,255 patients have recovered from the disease since its outbreak in March.

details.title: 11 IYC members held for violating COVID-19 guidelines during protest in Delhi, later released
details.content: Eleven members of the Indian Youth Congress (IYC) were arrested on Wednesday for allegedly violating COVID-19 guidelines while protesting in central Delhi against the Draft Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification, 2020, police said.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka see new highs in COVID cases; over 100 deaths in Tamil Nadu
details.content: Andhra Pradesh on Wednesday crossed 2.50 lakh overall cases of COVID-19, while Karnataka reported its highest single-day spike of 7,000-plus infections and Tamil Nadu witnessed yet another day of over 100 virus-related deaths.

details.title: Janmashtami: Temples in Rajasthan go digital amid pandemic
details.content: The usual hustle and bustle of devotees on the occasion of Janmashtami on Wednesday was missing in temples across Rajasthan this year as coronavirus-induced restrictions kept them confined to their homes.

details.title: 272 new coronavirus cases in Surat, highest in Gujarat
details.content: The number of coronavirus cases in Surat district rose to 16,554 with 272 new cases being reported on Wednesday, the highest in the state, said the Gujarat health department. With five new fatalities, the death toll in the district rose to 710.

details.title: Punjab Health Minister Balbir Singh Sidhu bans leaves, transfers of Health Department employees in state
details.content: Punjab Health Minister Balbir Singh Sidhu on Wednesday put a complete ban with immediate effect on leaves and transfers of Health Department employees in the state till September 30. The decision was taken in the wake of the rising number of coronavirus cases in the state.

details.title: Himachal Pradesh sees record single-day spike of 139 new COVID-19 cases
details.content: Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday registered record 139 new COVID-19 cases within 24 hours, taking the state's overall tally to 3,637. So far, the state has reported 17 deaths.

details.title: CBI officer among 37 test COVID positive in Meghalaya
details.content: Thirty-seven people, including a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) officer, tested positive for COVID-19 on Wednesday in Meghalaya, taking the state's coronavirus count to 1,179, a health department official said. Nineteen BSF staffers and two armed forces personnel were also among the 37 fresh cases.

details.title: Union Minister Shripad Naik tests positive for COVID-19, opts for home isolation
details.content: Union Minister Shripad Y Naik on Wednesday said he has tested positive for coronavirus infection and has opted for home isolation. The minister of state for AYUSH and defence said he opted for self-isolation as he is asymptomatic and added his vitals are within normal limits. (READ MORE)

details.title: Biggest single-day spike of 7,883 new cases in Karnataka
details.content: Karnataka on Wednesday reported the biggest single-day spike of 7,883 COVID-19 cases and 113 fatalities, taking the total number of infections to 1,96,494 and the death toll to 3,510. The day also saw 7,034 patients getting discharged after recovery.

details.title: Large scale COVID-19 tests conducted in Kozhikode
details.content:
Large scale #COVID19 tests conducted in Kozhikode.

details.title: Puducherry ​​​​​​​CM V Narayanasamy announces total lockdown on every Tuesday
details.content: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in the Union Territory of Puducherry, a total lockdown would be enforced every Tuesday to contain the spread of the virus. This was announced by Puducherry Chief Minister V Narayanasamy on Wednesday when the Union Territory registered its highest single-day spurt of 481 coronavirus cases and five deaths.

details.title: Amravati COVID-19 case tally reaches 3,391
details.content: The number of COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra's Amravati district rose by 154, which is the highest single-day addition so far, to 3,391 on Wednesday, officials said.

details.title: Kerala cops using call records of COVID-19 patients for contact tracing: CM Pinarayi Vijayan
details.content: COVID-19 patients' phone call detail records (CDRs) were being used by the police in Kerala as part of adopting innovative and scientific methods for effective contact tracing, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said on Wednesday.

details.title: Odisha government to bring ordinance to enhance punishment for non-compliance of COVID-19 guidelines
details.content: Alarmed at the unabated surge in Covid-19 cases in the state, the Odisha Government on Wednesday decided to bring an ordinance to enhance the punishment for non-compliance of the guidelines laid down for containing the spread of the deadly infection.

details.title: Immerse Ganesh idols at home: Thane hotspot residents told
details.content: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) on Wednesday said that those who reside in COVID-19 hotspots in the city should immerse the Ganpati idols at their home instead of stepping out for it.

details.title: Defying government directives, Bengal school restarts classes
details.content: Defying government directives, a state-run school in West Bengal's Paschim Medinipur district restarted classes on Wednesday, prompting the government to issue a notice to the headmaster.

details.title: 438 new coronavirus cases, four more deaths in Chhattisgarh
details.content: With 438 more people, including the wife of a former chief minister, testing positive for coronavirus in Chhattisgarh on Wednesday, the case count in the state rose to 13,498, a health officials said.

details.title: Bihar COVID death toll rises to 474, cases cross 90,000-mark
details.content: The COVID-19 death toll in Bihar mounted to 474 after nine patients succumbed to the disease, while 3,741 fresh cases of infection pushed state's coronavirus caseload to 90,553, a health department bulletin said on Wednesday.

details.title: 2,997 new cases of coronavirus in Pune
details.content: Pune district reported 2,997 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking its case count to 1,15,128, a health official said on Wednesday. The death toll in the district reached 2,619 with 67 patients succumbing to the infection.

details.title: Assam reports highest daily spike in infection with 4,593 cases as it tests record 1.43 lakh samples
details.content: Assam on Wednesday recorded the highest single-day spike in coronavirus infection with 4,593 new cases, taking the total cases to 68,999 while six patients died of COVID-19 during the day, Minister for Health and Family Welfare Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

details.title: Jharkhand's COVID-19 tally crosses 20,000-mark
details.content: Jharkhand on Wednesday reported 679 new cases of COVID-19, following which the state's tally crossed the 20,000-mark, as per an official bulletin. Eight persons also died during the day, taking the state's toll to 202, it said.

details.title: Defying government directives, Bengal school restarts classes
details.content: Defying government directives, a state-run school in West Bengal's Paschim Medinipur district restarted classes on Wednesday, prompting the government to issue a notice to the headmaster. (READ MORE)

details.title: Wearing PPE, TMC leader takes man with COVID symptoms to hospital on bike
details.content: A video of Patnaik, riding the bike wearing a PPE, and carrying Barik to the hospital has gone viral on social media. (READ MORE)
